c74object.name: the.jit.gl.material.vtfmaps
c74object.digest: Apply Normalmap and Heightmap Textures to a jit.gl.material @heightmap_mode vtf
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze Â© 2021, www.xenorama.com.
Apply Normalmap and Heightmap Textures to a jit.gl.material fetching its heightmap from texture vertices (vtf) without calculating its own normals internally which would not be adjustable (in heightmap_mode vtf_normals, for example).

attribute.name: amp
attribute.description: Amplitude of heightmap. Any real floating point number will adjust the amplitude of the heightmap accordingly. When the link flag is set to '1', this will also affect the normalmap.

attribute.name: scale
attribute.description: Scaling of normalmap. Any real floating point number will adjust the scaling of the normalmap accordingly. When the link flag is set to '1', this will also be affected by the heightmap.

attribute.name: link
attribute.digest: Link heightmap amplitude and normalmap scaling
attribute.description: Link heightmap amplitude and normalmap scaling. When this flag is set to '1' (default), the heightmap is amplified first and then affects the normalmap afterwards. When set to '0', normalmap and heightmap can be adjusted separately and the normalmap is unaffected by the heightmap.

method.name: sendnormals
method.description: send any natively supported message to the internal jit.gl.slab calculating the normalmap. Note that the normalmap texture from the first outlet is rectangular.

method.name: sendheightmap
method.description: send any natively supported message to the internal jit.gl.pix calculating the heightmap. Note that the heightmap texture from the second outlet is non-rectangular.
